trans-unit.source: The PowerShellTab Object
trans-unit.target: The PowerShellTab Object

trans-unit.source: The PowerShellTab Object
trans-unit.target: The PowerShellTab Object

trans-unit.source: The **PowerShellTab** object represents a Windows PowerShell runtime environment.
trans-unit.target: The **PowerShellTab** object represents a Windows PowerShell runtime environment.

trans-unit.source: Methods
trans-unit.target: Methods

trans-unit.source: Invoke\( Script \)
trans-unit.target: Invoke\( Script \)

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Runs the given script in the PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: Runs the given script in the PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: This method only works on other PowerShell tabs, not the PowerShell tab from which it is run.
trans-unit.target: This method only works on other PowerShell tabs, not the PowerShell tab from which it is run.

trans-unit.source: It does not return any object or value.
trans-unit.target: It does not return any object or value.

trans-unit.source: If the code modifies any variable, then those changes persist on the tab against which the command was invoked.
trans-unit.target: If the code modifies any variable, then those changes persist on the tab against which the command was invoked.

trans-unit.source: **Script** \- System.Management.Automation.ScriptBlock or String The script block to run.
trans-unit.target: **Script** \- System.Management.Automation.ScriptBlock or String The script block to run.

trans-unit.source: InvokeSynchronous\( Script, \[useNewScope\], millisecondsTimeout \)
trans-unit.target: InvokeSynchronous\( Script, \[useNewScope\], millisecondsTimeout \)

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Runs the given script in the PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: Runs the given script in the PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: This method only works on other PowerShell tabs, not the PowerShell tab from which it is run.
trans-unit.target: This method only works on other PowerShell tabs, not the PowerShell tab from which it is run.

trans-unit.source: The script block is run and any value that is returned from the script is returned to the run environment from which you invoked the command.
trans-unit.target: The script block is run and any value that is returned from the script is returned to the run environment from which you invoked the command.

trans-unit.source: If the command takes longer to run than the **millesecondsTimeout** value specifies, then the command fails with an exception: "The operation has timed out."
trans-unit.target: If the command takes longer to run than the **millesecondsTimeout** value specifies, then the command fails with an exception: "The operation has timed out."

trans-unit.source: **Script** \- System.Management.Automation.ScriptBlock or String The script block to run.
trans-unit.target: **Script** \- System.Management.Automation.ScriptBlock or String The script block to run.

trans-unit.source: **\[useNewScope\]** \- Optional Boolean that defaults to **$true** If set to **$true**, then a new scope is created within which to run the command.
trans-unit.target: **\[useNewScope\]** \- Optional Boolean that defaults to **$true** If set to **$true**, then a new scope is created within which to run the command.

trans-unit.source: It does not modify the runtime environment of the PowerShell tab that is specified by the command.
trans-unit.target: It does not modify the runtime environment of the PowerShell tab that is specified by the command.

trans-unit.source: **\[millisecondsTimeout\]** \- Optional integer that defaults to **500**.
trans-unit.target: **\[millisecondsTimeout\]** \- Optional integer that defaults to **500**.

trans-unit.source: If the command does not finish within the specified time, then the command generates a **TimeoutException** with the message "The operation has timed out."
trans-unit.target: If the command does not finish within the specified time, then the command generates a **TimeoutException** with the message "The operation has timed out."

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: AddOnsMenu
trans-unit.target: AddOnsMenu

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that gets the Add\-ons menu for the PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that gets the Add\-ons menu for the PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: CanInvoke
trans-unit.target: CanInvoke

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only Boolean property that returns a **$true** value if a script can be invoked with the [Invoke( Script )](#invoke) method.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only Boolean property that returns a **$true** value if a script can be invoked with the [Invoke( Script )](#invoke) method.

trans-unit.source: Consolepane
trans-unit.target: Consolepane

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 this was named **CommandPane**.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 this was named **CommandPane**.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that gets the Console pane [editor](../ise/The-ISEEditor-Object.md) object.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that gets the Console pane [editor](../ise/The-ISEEditor-Object.md) object.

trans-unit.source: DisplayName
trans-unit.target: DisplayName

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\-write property that gets or sets the text that is displayed on the PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: The read\-write property that gets or sets the text that is displayed on the PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: By default, tabs are named "PowerShell \#", where the \# represents a number.
trans-unit.target: By default, tabs are named "PowerShell \#", where the \# represents a number.

trans-unit.source: ExpandedScript
trans-unit.target: ExpandedScript

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\-write Boolean property that determines whether the Script pane is expanded or hidden.
trans-unit.target: The read\-write Boolean property that determines whether the Script pane is expanded or hidden.

trans-unit.source: Files
trans-unit.target: Files

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that gets the [collection of script files](../ise/The-ISEFileCollection-Object.md) that are open in the PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that gets the [collection of script files](../ise/The-ISEFileCollection-Object.md) that are open in the PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: Output
trans-unit.target: Output

trans-unit.source: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.
trans-unit.target: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.

trans-unit.source: In later versions of Windows PowerShell ISE, you can use the **ConsolePane** object for the same purposes.
trans-unit.target: In later versions of Windows PowerShell ISE, you can use the **ConsolePane** object for the same purposes.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that gets the Output pane of the current [editor](../ise/The-ISEEditor-Object.md).
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that gets the Output pane of the current [editor](../ise/The-ISEEditor-Object.md).

trans-unit.source: Prompt
trans-unit.target: Prompt

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that gets the current prompt text.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that gets the current prompt text.

trans-unit.source: Note: the **Prompt** function can be overridden by the user’s profile.
trans-unit.target: Note: the **Prompt** function can be overridden by the user’s profile.

trans-unit.source: If the result is other than a simple string, then this property returns nothing.
trans-unit.target: If the result is other than a simple string, then this property returns nothing.

trans-unit.source: ShowCommands
trans-unit.target: ShowCommands

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: The read\-write property that indicates if the Commands pane is currently displayed.
trans-unit.target: The read\-write property that indicates if the Commands pane is currently displayed.

trans-unit.source: StatusText
trans-unit.target: StatusText

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that gets the **PowerShellTab** status text.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that gets the **PowerShellTab** status text.

trans-unit.source: HorizontalAddOnToolsPaneOpened
trans-unit.target: HorizontalAddOnToolsPaneOpened

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that indicates whether the horizontal Add\-Ons tool pane is currently open.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that indicates whether the horizontal Add\-Ons tool pane is currently open.

trans-unit.source: VerticalAddOnToolsPaneOpened
trans-unit.target: VerticalAddOnToolsPaneOpened

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that indicates whether the vertical Add\-Ons tool pane is currently open.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that indicates whether the vertical Add\-Ons tool pane is currently open.
